Understate: The claim understates the fact that the video does not mention the coronavirus pandemic or the creation of the coronavirus.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the arrested scientist actually created the new coronavirus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the arrest of a Chinese scientist is directly linked to the creation of the new coronavirus, without providing evidence for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the arrest of the scientist is related to alleged ties to China and theft of trade secrets, rather than the creation of the coronavirus.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the FBI spokesperson confirmed that the arrest was not related to the COVID-19 outbreak.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the scientist "created" the new coronavirus without sufficient evidence to support this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters in providing accurate information by suggesting that the arrested scientist is from Boston University instead of Harvard University.
